intro: Cystogyne leucosticta, commonly known as the white-streaked gentian, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which are typically tubular and arranged in dense clusters. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central America and parts of South America. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. Cystogyne leucosticta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
